      • setStipplingPattern

        public void setStipplingPattern(short stipplingPattern)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoStrokeStyle
        specifies a number whose lower 16 bits define a pattern of which pixels in the image are white and which are transparent. Each bit corresponds to a pixel, and the pattern repeats after every n*16 pixels, where n is the factor. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit in the pattern is repeated three times before using the next bit
        Specified by:
        setStipplingPattern in interface IGeoStrokeStyle
        Parameters:
        stipplingPattern - specifies a number whose lower 16 bits define a pattern of which pixels in the image are white and which are transparent. Each bit corresponds to a pixel, and the pattern repeats after every n*16 pixels, where n is the factor. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit in the pattern is repeated three times before using the next bit

      • getStipplingPattern

        public short getStipplingPattern()
        Specified by:
        getStipplingPattern in interface IGeoStrokeStyle
        Returns:
        stipplingPattern specifies a number whose lower 16 bits define a pattern of which pixels in the image are white and which are transparent. Each bit corresponds to a pixel, and the pattern repeats after every n*16 pixels, where n is the factor. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit in the pattern is repeated three times before using the next bit

      • setStipplingFactor

        public void setStipplingFactor(int stipplingFactor)
        Description copied from interface: IGeoStrokeStyle
        specifies the number of times each bit in the pattern is repeated before the next bit is used. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit is repeated three times before using the next bit. The specified factor must be either 0 or an integer greater than 0. A factor of 0 indicates no stippling
        Specified by:
        setStipplingFactor in interface IGeoStrokeStyle
        Parameters:
        stipplingFactor - specifies the number of times each bit in the pattern is repeated before the next bit is used. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit is repeated three times before using the next bit. The specified factor must be either 0 or an integer greater than 0. A factor of 0 indicates no stippling

      • getStipplingFactor

        public int getStipplingFactor()
        Specified by:
        getStipplingFactor in interface IGeoStrokeStyle
        Returns:
        stipplingFactor specifies the number of times each bit in the pattern is repeated before the next bit is used. For example, if the factor is 3, each bit is repeated three times before using the next bit. The specified factor must be either 0 or an integer greater than 0. A factor of 0 indicates no stippling
